byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Pentagon proposes new plan to Obama administration to fortify network of military bases in Africa, Southwest Asia and Middle East in effort to stop further expansion of Islamic State beyond Syria; bases would be utilized for gathering intelligence and conducting strikes against far-reaching affiliates of militant group, as well as to provide hubs for troops planning future counterterrorism missions.
lead_paragraph: The bases would serve as hubs for Special Operations troops and intelligence agents who would conduct counterterrorism missions for the foreseeable future.

headline.main: Pentagon Seeks to Knit Foreign Bases Into ISIS-Foiling Network
